titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Joel Coleman, Alfred Francis, and William Coleman, Judgment
CWG5033

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Trigg Circuit Court
February 06th Term 1864
"The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against Forfeited Recognizance
Joel Coleman, Alfred Frances and William Coleman Defendants

The Defendant Alfred Frances appeared by his attorney, and filed his Response herein and this prosecution being heard. It is adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth recover of the ^said^ Defendant Alfred Frances the sum of Two hundred Dollars being the amount of the Recognizance entered into by him and the Costs herein expended and Execution is awarded, and on motion of the Commonwealths attorney It is ordered that this action be discontinued against the Defendants, Joel Coleman and Wm Coleman",

A Copy
Attest R A Bunnett Clk
Trigg Cir Ct

Trigg Cir Ct
Commonwealth
v } Copy Judgt
A. Frances
Forfeiture
$200
See Pet & Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
25th May/64
Examined
